page.title: 15COLBRED SHEEP -ABLINGTON
page.content: The large, white-faced sheep which graze on land belonging to Crickley Barrow Farm are the result of a careful, scientific breeding programme which started in the 1950's. The aim was to produce a type of sheep chiefly designed for the meat trade, the carcass being leaner and heavier in comparison with many pedigree sheep. The Colbreds are docile and particularly trouble-free at lambing time. Recently they have been used for the production of milk which is sold in England on a commercial basis. The sheep are now being exported to Italy and Ireland, and their commercial qualities are increasingly being recognized in all parts of Great Britain.
